alert.note: Alert for Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 19 at 6:08PM CDT until April 19 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN NEMAHA COUNTY... At 606 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Seneca, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 600 PM CDT, golf ball size hail was reported 1 mile south of Baileyville. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Seneca, Bern, Oneida and Baileyville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Kansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
